title: Lucida Sans , ITC Syndor or What -- Unable to decide what is the font ?
content:
Hello Everyone,

Kindly advice me the right font face.

Thanks everyone in advance for their help, input or even looking.

Regards,  
Hasnain

Font: 

 Androgyne 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055441/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

author: hasnain125

comments.content:
[Androgyne](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055441/http:/www.dafont.com/androgyne-tb.font) by Dimitri Castrique  
(and another freebie for the tagline with [Sansation](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317055441/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/sansation))

I read the comments at Dafont regarding Androgyne including this accusation of piracy:

----start quote---  
xDupre Aug 02, 2010  
I don't know how long Mr. Bigelow spent to design TEXTILE but I know I spent more than one year to design FF TARTINE SCRIPT.

This Androgyne is an interpolation between these 2 fonts. I did this operation, we arrive to the same result in less than 2 minutes. Then, you probably spent 1 or 2 hours to remove the inconsistencies...

Dimitri, if you want to mix Textile and FF Tartine Script, you can do it for your personal use BUT NOT sharing it on DAFONT.

I invite users to use professionnal fonts to support designers who spend a lot of time designing typefaces.  
Check out my website to discover food types like the real FF Tartine Script or the completely new FF MASALA!  
----end quote---  
I would be very hesitant to use this font for anything commercial.  
Don
